answers.answer: I read that,that can be a sign of preclamsia orhhow ever you spell it.. You should call your doctor

Oh no! I hope not I was thinking It could be down to me being on my feet all day I was on my feet from 9Am til like 8pm yesterday so it could be down to that but thanks il give them a call and see what happens :)
Or yeah that can be why too, but just call your doctor to be sure.. Better safe then sorry ya know?

It could be because you were on your feet all day. I work two days and on those days my feet get super swollen because I'm on them from 6 am to about 10 pm. I've told my doctor and she said that as long as my bp isn't high, which it isn't, then not to worry. Just to elevate my feet as much as possible. But still call ur doctor just to let them know. Good luck!

Its probably just from being on your feet to long keep them elevated it should take the swelling down. I have a history of preeclampsia. swelling in pregnancy is normal. with preeclampsia you yes your feet do get swollen but so does your face and hands along with having bad headaches and vision change. Just keep an eye out :)

question: When you have swollen feet and ankles?
title: Is it anything to worry about
